alert.note: Alert for Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 12:53PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Park and southwestern Jefferson Counties through 130 PM MDT... At 1252 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout tornado 6 miles northeast of Tarryall Reservoir, or 43 miles southwest of Denver, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bailey and Wellington Lake. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet
